ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You have to take this class, but won't get anything out of it. Just show up and do it.
Yes, it helps to practice presentation skill.

You read papers weekly, write a summary on it and then listen to your classmates present. You can ask questions at the end and fill out evaluations. Probably wouldnt recommend it because we get more practice presenting to our labs than we do w/ this class.

The course requires only about an hour or so of prep work per week. Discussions are much better during the second "classics" semester than during the fall "current" semester. The course is required, so the recommendation part isn't really applicable.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I don't feel that this course really deepens knowledge of genetics. It was nice to have the evaluation forms to help us improve our presentation skills, but I think it would be better to improve our presentation skills regarding our own science instead of unrelated papers. The classics discussions were more interesting and led to thoughtful conversation regarding the discipline, but the course does not really contribute anything to my own research.
